item.description:
Difficulty: Easy/beginner (est. 3.5-miles, with hills)

Time: 12:30-ish, I'm coming straight from work!

Where: South Main Street, New Salem, is off Route 202 (Daniel Shays Highway), on the Northbound side of the road. S Main St is a "live" neighborhood that dead-ends. Park as far down as you can, and we'll gather on foot at Gate 25, which is beyond the town common. (NOTE: This is not E Main Street, where we went in summer, but the hikes overlap.)

Description: The trails are old dirt roads with hills. There are some lovely shoreline views! Mid-way, there are nice beaches on a "corner" of the shore, though they are probably under water. Still, where the old roads go into the water, there's AWESOME views nearly 10 miles, to islands at the southern end of Quabbin Reservoir!

I brake for bald eagles! I estimate hike and lunch to take 2-3 hours depending on the slowest in the group...but if we are lucky enough to see bald eagles (or other wildlife), I'll be taking some pictures!

Information: Bring a snack, water, and non-leaky shoes. (Some areas may be wet.) Camera recommended! There is an outhouse near the shore. Also, on Route 202, across from S Main St., the "New Salem General Store" has an outhouse, food, books, maps, and other conveniences. You may want to stop there before the hike.

Microspikes should not be needed unless we get bad weather the day before. The old roads in this area get plenty of sun.

  • This is a public water supply...no pets are allowed.
  • Trash is "carry in, carry out"...there are no receptacles.
  • No swimming or wading, or removing things from the reservation.

I still have an overflowing email box due to many chores and filling in for sick people at work. I may not see your email. Please ask questions by using the "comment" feature at the bottom of this meetup.
item.how_to_find_us: South Main Street, New Salem, off Route 202 (Daniel Shays Highway). I drive a small, white Dodge Stratus 4-door.

group.name: Northern Central MA, Southern NH Hiking Group

item.name: Weekday Hike: Quabbin Reservoir Gate 25
